specific_issues.description: Worked with Federal Officials, Staff, Members of Congress and Staff and Relevant Committees and Subcommittees to draft legislative language to enable client and other water districts with viable water reclamation and other projects to compete for future Title XVI Water Reclamation Design and Construction WaterSMART grants, which are appropriated on an annual basis to the U.S. Department of the Interior for a competitive process through the Bureau of Reclamation. Worked with the same regarding authorization issue for water projects seeking authorization once they have met statutory requirements through the Bureau of Reclamation, i.e., once they have received an official feasibility declaration by the Bureau of Reclamation. Discussion of Appropriations Programmatic Priorities. Briefed Officials/Staff on WaterSMART grants, USEPA State SRFs client is currently using-funding received through the state. Progress of clients current and future water and infrastructure projects underway. Briefed Officials and Staff on efforts to assist agricultural customers to seek federal funding for water conservation efforts. Gathered intelligence from Federal Departments and Agencies and the Congress regarding available federal programs for water projects with a federal nexus. Continued educating Federal Representatives, Officials and Staff regarding projects currently underway and projected to meet service area needs and federal and state water conservation and efficiency standards and requirements. Prognosis for FY16 and beyond appropriations/grants/federal projects and assistance needed.

ali_info.federal_agencies: U.S. SENATE, U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES, Agriculture - Dept of (USDA), Army - Dept of (Corps of Engineers), Bureau of Reclamation, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Interior - Dept of (DOI)
